Package ohos.accessibility.ability

Class SoftKeyBoardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.accessibility.ability.SoftKeyBoardController

  • public class SoftKeyBoardController
extends Object
    Provides a soft keyboard controller.

    This controller offers the following functions:

    1. Registering a listener to observe changes of the soft keyboard's show/hide mode.
    2. Controlling the soft keyboard's show/hide mode.
    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Accessibility#ABILITY

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener​(SoftKeyBoardListener listener)
        Adds a SoftKeyBoardListener instance to observe changes of the soft keyboard's show/hide mode.
        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to add.

      • deleteListener

        public boolean deleteListener​(SoftKeyBoardListener listener)
        Removes the specified SoftKeyBoardListener instance.
        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to remove.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the listener is successfully removed; returns false otherwise.

      • getShowMode

        public int getShowMode​()
        Obtains the show/hide mode of this soft keyboard.
        Returns:
        Returns the show/hide mode of this soft keyboard. Value 0 indicates that the soft keyboard is shown, value 1 indicates that the soft keyboard is hidden, and value 2 indicates that the soft keyboard is still shown when an external keyboard is connected.
        See Also:
        AccessibleAbility.SHOW_MODE_AUTO, AccessibleAbility.SHOW_MODE_HIDE, AccessibleAbility.SHOW_MODE_IGNORE_HARD_KEYBOARD

      • setShowMode

        public boolean setShowMode​(int showMode)
        Sets the show/hide mode of the soft keyboard.
        Parameters:
        showMode - Indicates the show/hide mode to set. Value AccessibleAbility#SHOW_MODE_AUTO indicates that the soft keyboard is shown, value AccessibleAbility#SHOW_MODE_HIDE indicates that the soft keyboard is hidden,and value AccessibleAbility#SHOW_MODE_IGNORE_HARD_KEYBOARD indicates that the soft keyboard is still shown when an external keyboard is connected.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
